content.question: Which of the following graphs is the solution to the logistic differential equation <math><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>y</mi><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaamizaiaadMhaa8aabaWdbiaadsgacaWG0baa aiabg2da9maalaaapaqaa8qacaWG5baapaqaa8qacaaI1aaaamaabm aapaqaa8qacaaIXaGaeyOeI0YaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaadMhaa8aabaWd biaaiwdacaaIWaGaaGimaaaaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@4409@</annotation></semantics></math> with the initial condition  <math><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>100</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVCI8FfYJH8YrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbb a9q8WqFfeaY=biLkVcLq=JHqpepeea0=as0Fb9pgeaYRXxe9vr0=vr 0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaamyEa8aadaqadaqaa8qacaaIWaaapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qacaqG GaGaeyypa0JaaeiiaiaaigdacaaIWaGaaGimaaaa@3E05@</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no numbers indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the numbers 100 through 500, in increments of 100, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at 100, and moves upward and to the right. It moves gradually at first, and then moves more steadily upward as it moves along the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no numbers indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the numbers 100 through 500, in increments of 100, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at 500 and moves downward and to the right. The curve begins to level off approximately halfway along the horizontal axis as it approaches a dashed horizontal line at y equals 100.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no numbers indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the numbers 100 through 500, in increments of 100, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at 100 and moves upward and to the right initially until it reaches a maximum approximately halfway along the horizontal axis, at 500 on the vertical axis. At this point, the graph then moves downward and to the right until it ends near the end of the horizontal axis, at 100 on the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no numbers indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the numbers 100 through 500, in increments of 100, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at 100 and moves upward and to the right. The curve begins to level off approximately halfway along the horizontal axis as it approaches a dashed horizontal line at y equals 500.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are no numbers indicated. The vertical axis is labeled y, and the numbers 100 through 500, in increments of 100, are indicated. The curve begins on the vertical axis at 100 and moves upward and to the right. The curve begins to level off approximately halfway along the horizontal axis as it approaches a dashed horizontal line at y equals 500.
